data.title: Gujranwala Gazetteer
data.text: CHAPTER I INTRODUCTION OF THE DISTRICT TOPOGRAPHY Gujranwala district is the fourth largest district of Punjab in terms of population. It is the largest district in Gujranwala division in terms of area and population. it is located at 32.16° north latitude and 74.18° east longitude. The total area of the tehsil is 3,622 sq. kms. It occupies the upper centre of the Rachna Doab, being intermediate in natural features, fertility and conditions of agriculture. Its northern boundary fronts the Chenab river and divides it from Gujrat (located at a distance of 50 kms). Sialkot lies to the north-east at a distance of 55 kms. Gujrat connects Gujranwala with Bhimber and Mirpur AJ&K, while Sialkot connects it to Jammu. On the western side, it borders with Hafizabad and Mandi Bahaulddin districts. Sheikhupura lies on the south of Gujranwala district at a distance of 55 kms. The provincial Capital i.e. Lahore is located to the south of Gujranwala at a distance of 65 kms. With the exception of the Chenab lowlands along the north-west boundary sloping towards the river and the Deg valley on the south-east, the rest of the district consists of an alluvial plain, slightly elevated, and of almost unbroken evenness, declining imperceptibly towards the south-west. The mean length is 45 and the mean width 65 miles. TEHSILS IN DISTRICT GUJRANWALA 1) Tehsil City Gujranwala This Tehsil was established in year 1999. The 100% area of this tehsil is urbanized. As per 2017 census, the population of this tehsil is 2,027,001 and this tehsil is the most densely populated in the district. The total area of the tehsil is 39,747 acres. The major castes are Butt, Arain, Gujjar, Rajput, Ansari and Jutts. There are 11 Patwar Circles in which there are 28 Revenue estates (Mouzas). Out of 28 mouzas, there are 19 mouzas which are online, while 9 are still manual. The important historical places in tehsil City are: Masjid Sher Shah Suri, Clock House in Guru Nanak Pura DC Office, Talaab Wali Masjid, Islamia College, Birthplace of Raja Ranjit Singh, Jain Mandir, Aatma Ram Samadhi, Bhabhri Wala Mandir and Saint Merry School. 8
